title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.37 | 12-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamini Tinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devim Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
In this session we will be discussing from the 37th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Tad Vadastasya Hi Shreyo Yad Doshad Yad Yad Pumaan
A cruel and wretched person who maintains his existence
at the cost of others' lives
deserves to be killed for his own well-being
otherwise he will go down by his own actions
Ashwathama has committed a very serious crime
and if he is not punished now
he is going to degrade himself
and he is going to suffer the reaction
so he has to be punished
So Srila Prabhupada elaborately explains this in the purport
A life for a life is just punishment for a person who cruelly and shamelessly lives
at the cost of others' lives
discussion nowadays is going on that uh...
punishment is not justified capital punishment is to a for a murder for a
murderer if the if the laws of the land punish him by by giving him a punishment
where he'll be able to become free from the reaction when is punished properly
appropriately political morality is to punish a person by a death sentence in
order to save a cruel person from going to hell the punishment in hell is much

Just this death sentence now, because he has committed a murder or he has killed somebody unjustly. So instead of pardoning him and making him suffer in hell in future, it is better that he be punished now.
That a murderer is condemned to a death sentence by the state is good for the culprit, because in his next life, he will not have to suffer for his act of murder.
See, people sometimes say, I can't remember what all I did in my previous life. Why am I made to suffer now?
That's because you have to suffer.
You have done the mistake and you did not atone for it, nor you received punishment for the mistake you did.
So neither you atoned nor you received punishment. Therefore, in the next life, you have to suffer the reaction.
Such a death sentence for the murderer is the lowest.
Lowest possible punishment offered to him.
And it is said in the Smriti Shastras that men who are punished by the king on the principle of life for a life are purified of all their sins.
See, they became purified, even though they might have committed a very, very grievous sin of killing another person.
So much so that they may be eligible for being promoted to the planets of heaven.
So they are completely freed from the reaction of having for having committed that sin if they are punished appropriately.
Here, according to Manu, the great author of civic codes and religious principles, Manu is a lawgiver for mankind.
Even the killer of an animal is to be considered a murderer.
Nowadays, people are killing animals so much because animal food is never meant for the civilized man whose prime duty is to prepare himself for going back to Godhead.
In a civilized society, when there is plenty of vegetables, fruits, grains, milk, why should people kill animals for food?
That is the point being made here.
Animal food is never meant for the civilized man.
And especially civilized human beings are meant for preparing themselves to go back to Godhead.
That is a precious opportunity in this human form of life.

So Manu says that in the act of killing an animal, there is a regular conspiracy by the party of sinners and all of them are liable to be punished as murderers, exactly like a party of conspirators who kill a human being combinedly.
Just like the state law, if a murder happens,
it's not just the person who actually killed is punished.
Even the others who may be hatching a conspiracy to kill and they engage somebody to kill.
Even the conspirators are equally guilty of this murder.
Similarly, in killing of an animal,
will all actually be liable to be punished.
that who are all liable to be punished when an animal killing happens?
he who sells the slaughtered animal,
he who administers distribution of that foodstuff,
and at last he who eats such cooked animal food are all murderers.
Six kinds of persons involved in animal killing are all murderers.
Even though actual killing is done by one person.
He who gives permission to kill the animal,
he actually sells that animal for animal slaughter.
Or he may not sell it,
Oh, now this animal is of no use to me.
You may take it and you may do whatever you want.
He is not absolved of that sin of animal killing.
So the person who gives permission,
the person who kills the animal,
obviously he is liable to be punished.
He who sells the slaughtered animal,
for those who want to eat meat,
somebody is going to cook that meat.
Because human beings don't eat raw flesh.
Unlike tigers and lions and all those carnivorous animals,
So somebody is cooking that flesh.
those who administer distribution of this cooked meat,
somebody is engaged in distributing it.
the person who eats cooked animal food
Six types of people are liable to be punished
All of them are liable to be punished,
Because no one can create a living being
despite all advancement of material science.
no one has the right to kill a living being
if an animal is sacrificed in a yajna,
the animal which was killed will be revived.
It will be given a new life.
By brahmanas who know how to chant mantras
for the sake of the sacrifice,
such animal is given a new life.
they are not reviving the animal,
they don't know how to give new life,
so they are liable to be punished.
They cannot kill animals like that.
just to restrict the opening of slaughterhouses.
This animal sacrifice sanctioned in the scriptures
is never meant for animal killing.
and also good for the animal eaters.
the animal sacrifice to be performed
It's good for the animal in the sense that
the sacrificed animal is at once
promoted to the human form of life
After being sacrificed at the altar,
to the human form of life.
It doesn't have to wait for
gradual evolution to the human form.
And the animal eater is saved
eating meat supplied by organized slaughterhouses.
If at all they want to eat
for animal sacrifice to be performed
to society, country and the people in general.
there is a wholesale sinful reaction
the people in general have to suffer.

It's not good for the society.
